resources.name: Read All
resources.description: Gives a list of all the survivors registered in the database, listed from A to Z.

resources.name: Survivors
resources.description: This folder comprises all requests available for the survivors: list of all surivors, reports on abuction rates, access to a single survivor, updating location, flag a survivor as abducted, delete a survivor from the database.

resources.name: New Document
resources.description:
# X-SUNIT

This project is a business case developed as a part of Gocase Brasil internship selection program.

It was developed using Ruby on Rails and its purpose is to simulate an API where humans during an allien apocalypse can update their location, report survivors and abductions. Based on this information, the program generates reports on percentage of survivors, percentage of abductions and a list of the names of the survivors.


## Authentication
No authentication is needed to make requests on this API.

## Error Codes
### 400 â€“ Bad Request

The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error.

### 422 - Unprocessable Entity

The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

resources.name: Reports
resources.description: Gives a report on the percentage of both abducted and non-abducted survivors.

resources.name: Read One
resources.description: Shows a specific survivor and their attributes, with the url pointing to their ID.

resources.name: Create
resources.description:
Register a surviver on the database.
Each survivor must have a name.
Optional attributes are: age, gender, location (latitude and longitude), flags.
An abduction status is set based on the number of abduction flags a surviver has received.

_The abduction column was created as "generated" from flags column on PostgreSQL. Since when you fisrt survivor a user there is no value set on flags (even though a default value is set), the abduction value is not read at first, which triggers an error. However, the surivor is created anyway.
For the same reason, the flags has to be set as 3 more than once so that the abduction can be set to true._

resources.name: Update
resources.description:
Update location of the survivor, without keeping track of the previous ones.
Age, gender and flags can also be updated with this method.
The url must point to the registered ID.

resources.name: Flag
resources.description:
Uses the same method as "Update" to update flag numbers. 

_This method could be enhanced by setting the data type as array and letting other survivors add flags to it. These flags would be counted and when the size of the array reaches 3, abduction status would be set to true. However, I couldn't implement adding data to the array in JSON, so I declared Flags as an integer, which is a weak point in the application since a single survivor might set the flags number from 0 to 3 in a single update._

resources.name: Delete
resources.description: Deletes a survivor from the database.
